name: outspokenly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that expresses strong opinions very directly without worrying if other people are offended: He was outspokenly opposed to the war and could be seen protesting in the town square every Saturday. She was outspokenly critical of the country's foreign policy.
More examplesFewer examplesThe senator continued to lobby outspokenly for voting rights legislation even after his retirement. He was a successful businessman and was outspokenly liberal in his politics. She actively and outspokenly opposes nuclear weapons.
